quizzes.question: Where does Javascript live?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Your First JavaScript[/h1]

JavaScript lives inside the [b]HTML document[/b]. 
Below is a simple HTML document, with [b]<head>[/b] and [b]<body>[/b] tags, in which we will write our JavaScript code. [img id="2731" width="100%"]

quizzes.question: What tag contains the JavaScript code?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Your First JavaScript[/h1]

In HTML, JavaScript code must be inserted between [b]<script>[/b] and [b]</script> [/b]tags: [code format="html"]<script>
   ...
</script>[/code]
JavaScript can be placed in the HTML page's [b]<body>[/b] and [b]<head> [/b]sections.
In the example below, we placed it within the [b]<body>[/b] tag. [img id="2732" width="100%"]

quizzes.question:
Please type in a code to output the "Hello world!" text on the screen.
[!raw!]
<script>
{0}("Hello world!");
</script>
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Output[/h1]

Let's use JavaScript to print "Hello World" to the browser.[code format="html" codeId="642"]<html>
   <head> </head>
   <body>
     <script>
[b]       document.write[/b]("Hello World!");
     </script>
   </body>
</html> [/code]
The [b]document.write()[/b] function writes a string into our HTML document. This function can be used to write text, HTML, or both. 

The above code displays the following result: [img id="2733" width="100%"]
[note]The [b]document.write()[/b] method should be used only for testing. Other output mechanisms appear in the upcoming lessons.[/note]

quizzes.question: Which choice can be added within the text to be displayed?
quizzes.textContent: [h1]Formatting Text[/h1] Just like in HTML, we can use HTML tags to format text in JavaScript. For example, we can output the text as a heading.[code format="html" codeId="643"] [/code] [b]Result:[/b] [img id="2734" width="100%"]
